sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations:

x + 2y - z = 5

2x - y + 3z = 7

x - y/2 + 4z/3 = -1/3

Hint: The system of equations can be represented as AX = B, where A is the coefficient matrix, X is the variable matrix, and B is the constant matrix.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we will first represent it in the matrix form AX = B, where A is the coefficient matrix, X is the variable matrix, and B is the constant matrix.

A = | 1   2  -1 |
    | 2  -1   3 |
    | 1 -1/2 4/3 |

X = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

B = |  5  |
    |  7  |
    | -1/3 |

Now, we will find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv) and then multiply it with matrix B to get the values of x, y, and z.

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A)

First, we need to find the determinant of matrix A (det(A)):

det(A) = 1(-1(-6) - 3(4)) - 2(2(-6) - 3(4)) - (-1)(2(-3) - (-1)(4))
       = 1(6 - 12) - 2(-12 - 12) - (-1)(-6 + 4)
       = 1(-6) - 2(-24) - (-1)(-2)
       = -6 + 48 + 2
       = 44

Now, we will find the adjoint of matrix A (adj(A)):

adj(A) = | (-1)(-6) - 3(4)   (2)(4) - 3(4)   (2)(-6) - (-1)(4) |
         | (1/2)(4) - 4(4/3)  (1)(-6) - 4(4/3) (1)(4) - (-1)(4/3) |
         | (1/2)(-3) - (-1)(4) (1)(4) - 2(4)   (1)(-6) - 2(-3)   |

adj(A) = |  6 - 12   8 - 12   -12 + 4  |
         | 2/3 - 16/3 -6 + 16/3 4 - 4/3 |
         | -3/2 + 4  4 - 8   -6 + 6    |

adj(A) = | -6  -4  -8 |
         | -14 2   8/3 |
         | 1/2  -4  0  |

Now, we will find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv):

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A)

A_inv = 1/44 * | -6  -4  -8 |
               | -14  2  8/3 |
               | 1/2  -4  0  |

Now, we will multiply A_inv with B to get the values of x, y, and z:

X = A_inv * B

X = 1/44 * | -6  -4  -8 | * |  5  |
           | -14  2  8/3 |   |  7  |
           | 1/2  -4  0  |   | -1/3 |

X = 1/44 * | -30 - 20 - 40/3 |
           | -70 + 14 + 56/3 |
           | 5/2 - 16 - 0    |

X = 1/44 * | -50 - 40/3 |
           | -56 + 56/3 |
           | -11/2      |

X = | 1  |
    | -1 |
    | 2  |

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 1, y = -1, and z = 2.
